Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2009 06:41PM moonwolf wrote: A nurse told me that I could never expose the radiated breast to sun. I was very disappointed to hear that, but it seems I can afterall.     I will wait for a year tho.  Meanwhile, I have been tanning the rest of me whilst keeping the rads area well covered.   I finished rads this week. Actually, we do need fifteen minutes a day unprotected exposure to get enough vitimin D.  Lack of vit D puts one at more risk of cancer!
Posts.Title: Tanning after Radiation Jeanne_D Jeanne_D

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 07:04AM moonwolf wrote: bluedasher - I finished chemo 15 weeks ago, finished rads 2 weeks ago. I think the general rule in UK is start Herceptin 6 weeks after rads. It must be awful having Herceptin at the same time as chemo - two lots of side effects and not knowing which is causing what!  Possibly some gals have the both together over here - I will ask.
